result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Deontayjah S Walton in court. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft is still trying to resolve her employment issue with the SPD's office.
Deft is having problems getting a hold of her previous employer.
Deft is ready to get these cases over with and would like to proceed w/o an atty.
State indicate their may be a diversion program offer on the CM file for dismissal, if deft can get her DL the State will amend the charge in the CT file.
Deft needs to go to a points reduction school before she can get her DL.
Deft would like to handle these cases on her own.
Court goes offer the record to allow the deft to fill out the Petition for a court appointed atty.
BACK ON THE RECORD 2:24PM -
All appearances remain the same.
Deft has filled out the Petition for a court appointed atty.
BTC: Deft to go back to the SPD's office, will hold off appointing counsel until the next court date.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
